alert.note: Alert for Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; Northwest Pinal County; Pinal, Superstition Mountains; Southeast Valley, Queen Creek; Superior (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 07 at 5:45PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Gila, Maricopa and Pinal Counties through 630 PM MST... At 545 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Florence Junction, or 10 miles southeast of Gold Canyon, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Apache Junction, Florence, Superior, Gold Canyon, Queen Creek, Gold Camp, Magma, San Tan Valley, Florence Junction, Queen Valley, Kings Ranch, Boyce Thompson Arboretum and San Tan Mountain Park. This includes the following highways... US Highway 60 between mile markers 201 and 232. AZ Route 79 between mile markers 129 and 150. AZ Route 177 between mile markers 159 and 167. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; Northwest Pinal County; Pinal, Superstition Mountains; Southeast Valley, Queen Creek; Superior
